file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-00-01-04 - CONFIG-1 - FIRE PANEL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FIRE PANEL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the fire panel. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-D BAGGAGE 26-00-01-000-801-A FIRE PANEL - REMOVAL COMPARTMENT AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-D BAGGAGE 26-00-01-400-801-A FIRE PANEL - INSTALLATION COMPARTMENT AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-C BAGGAGE 26-00-01-000-802-A FIRE PANEL - REMOVAL COMPARTMENT AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-C BAGGAGE 26-00-01-400-802-A FIRE PANEL - INSTALLATION COMPARTMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 1 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-00-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-D BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 2. FIRE PANEL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the fire panel. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective caps For protection of the electrical connectors 2 available E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-012-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • ENG 1 FIRE DETECTION. • ENG 2 FIRE DETECTION. • APU FIRE EXTG. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-007-A (1) Loosen the Dzus fasteners (5) which attach the fire panel (4) to the panel (1). (2) Carefully pull the fire panel (4) from its housing to get access to the electrical connectors (2) and (3). CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU REMOVE THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL PINS. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 2 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Hold the fire panel (4) and disconnect the electrical connector (3) from the electrical connector (2). CAUTION: INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS ON THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS TO PREVENT ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE (ESD) AT THE ELECTRICAL PINS. (4) Install protective caps on the electrical connectors (2) and (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 3 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-D BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT Fire Panel - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A B ZONES 225 226 DET. A 1. PANEL 2. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 3. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 4. FIRE PANEL 5. DZUS FASTENER (2) DET. B 145AMM260225.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 4 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-00-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-D BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 3. FIRE PANEL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the fire panel. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 26-10-00-700-801-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-013-A (1) Make sure that these circuit breakers are open: • ENG 1 FIRE DETECTION. • ENG 2 FIRE DETECTION. • APU FIRE EXTG. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-007-A (1) Remove the protective caps from the electrical connectors (3) and (2). CAUTION:YOU MUST ALIGN THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR PLUG WITH THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR PINS BEFORE YOU INSTALL THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR. IF NOT, DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR AND/OR PINS CAN OCCUR. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 5 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Hold the fire panel (4) and connect the electrical connector (3) to the electrical connector (2). (3) Carefully put the fire panel (4) in position. (4) Tighten the Dzus fasteners (5) to attach the fire panel (4) to the panel (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-007-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them: • ENG 1 FIRE DETECTION. • ENG 2 FIRE DETECTION • APU FIRE EXTG (2) Do the Fire Detection System - Operational Check (AMM TASK 26-10-00-700-801-A/ 500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 6 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-00-01-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-C BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 4. FIRE PANEL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the fire panel. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective caps For protection of the electrical connectors 2 available E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-014-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • ENG 1 FIRE DETECTION. • ENG 2 FIRE DETECTION. • BAGG FIRE EXTG. • APU FIRE DETECTION. • APU FIRE EXTG I. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-008-A (1) Loosen the Dzus fasteners (5) which attach the fire panel (4) to the panel (1). (2) Carefully pull the fire panel (4) from its housing to get access to the electrical connectors (2) and (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 7 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU REMOVE THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL PINS. (3) Hold the fire panel (4) and disconnect the electrical connector (3) from the electrical connector (2). CAUTION: INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS ON THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS TO PREVENT ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE (ESD) TO THE ELECTRICAL PINS. (4) Install protective caps on the electrical connectors (2) and (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 8 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-00-01-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-C BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 5. FIRE PANEL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the fire panel. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 26-10-00-700-802-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-015-A (1) Make sure that these circuit breakers are open: • ENG 1 FIRE DETECTION. • ENG 2 FIRE DETECTION. • BAGG FIRE EXTG. • APU FIRE DETECTION. • APU FIRE EXTG. J. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-008-A (1) Remove the protective caps from the electrical connectors (3) and (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 26-00-01 Page 10 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION:YOU MUST ALIGN THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR PLUG WITH THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR PINS BEFORE YOU INSTALL THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR. IF NOT, DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR AND/OR PINS CAN OCCUR. (2) Hold the fire panel (4) and connect the electrical connector (3) to the electrical connector (2). (3) Carefully put the fire panel (4) in position. (4) Tighten the Dzus fasteners (5) to attach the fire panel (4) to the panel (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-008-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them: • ENG 1 FIRE DETECTION. • ENG 2 FIRE DETECTION. • BAGG FIRE EXTG. • APU FIRE DETECTION. • APU FIRE EXTG. (2) Do the Fire Detection System - Operational Check (AMM TASK 26-10-00-700-802-A/ 500).
